marytts.tools.analysis
Class TranscriptionAligner

java.lang.Object
  marytts.tools.analysis.TranscriptionAligner

public class TranscriptionAligner
extends java.lang.Object

This class aligns a label file with an XML file in MARY ALLOPHONES format, modifying the structure of the XML file as needed to match the label file. After calling alignXMLTranscriptions(), it is guaranteed that an iteration through all PHONE and BOUNDARY nodes of the XML file matches the label file.

Author:
marc

This reads in a label file and returns a String of the phonetic symbols, separated by the entry separator character entrySeparator.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if something goes wrong with opening/reading the file

distanceAlign

public java.lang.String distanceAlign(java.lang.String in,
                                      java.lang.String out)
This computes the alignment that has the lowest distance between two Strings. There are three differences to the normal Levenshtein-distance: 1. Only insertions and deletions are allowed, no replacements (i.e. no "diagonal" transitions) 2. insertion costs are dependent on a particular phone on the input side (the one they are aligned to) 3. deletion is equivalent to a symbol on the input side that is not aligned. There are costs associated with that. The method returns the output string with alignment boundaries ('#') inserted.

Parameters:
in -
out -
Returns:

alignXmlTranscriptions

public void alignXmlTranscriptions(org.w3c.dom.Document allophones,
                                   java.lang.String labels)
                            throws java.lang.Exception
This changes the transcription of a MARYXML document in ALLOPHONES format to match the label sequence given as the "labels" parameter. The symbols of the original transcription are aligned to corrected ones, with which they are replaced in turn.

Parameters:
allophones - the MARYXML document, in ALLOPHONES format
labels - the sequence of label symbols to use, separated by the entry separator as provided by getEntrySeparator().
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if a manual label is encountered that is not in the AllophoneSet

alignLabels

public AlignedLabels alignLabels(Labels first,
                                 Labels second)
Align the two given sequences of labels and return a mapping array indicating which index in first should be aligned to which index in second.

Parameters:
first -
second -
Returns:
an array m of integers -- for each index i in first, m[i] gives the (rightmost) corresponding index in second.
